name: AddTaskToProject
description:
Add a task to a specified Asana project.

Use this to add a task to a specific project within Asana, optionally specifying the location. It can also reorder a task within a project. Only one of `insert_before`, `insert_after`, or `section` should be used to specify the location. Tasks can be associated with up to 20 projects.

parameters.name: task_global_id
parameters.description: The unique global ID of the task to be operated on.

parameters.name: project_id_to_add_task
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project to which the task will be added.

value_schema.description: The project to add the task to.

parameters.name: insert_after_task_id
parameters.description: Provide the ID of a task in the project to insert this task after, or use 'null' to insert at the beginning.

value_schema.description: A task in the project to insert the task after, or `null` to insert at the beginning of the list.

parameters.name: insert_task_before
parameters.description: Specify a task ID to insert the new task before it in the project, or use `null` to insert at the end of the list.

value_schema.description: A task in the project to insert the task before, or `null` to insert at the end of the list.

parameters.name: target_section_id
parameters.description: The ID of the section in the project to insert the task at the bottom.

value_schema.description: A section in the project to insert the task into. The task will be inserted at the bottom of the section.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true for formatted JSON output, making it more readable. Useful for debugging. Note: This increases response time and size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: data.project
parameters.description: The project to add the task to.

value_schema.description: The project to add the task to.

parameters.name: data.insert_after
parameters.description: A task in the project to insert the task after, or `null` to insert at the beginning of the list.

value_schema.description: A task in the project to insert the task after, or `null` to insert at the beginning of the list.

parameters.name: data.insert_before
parameters.description: A task in the project to insert the task before, or `null` to insert at the end of the list.

value_schema.description: A task in the project to insert the task before, or `null` to insert at the end of the list.

parameters.name: data.section
parameters.description: A section in the project to insert the task into. The task will be inserted at the bottom of the section.

value_schema.description: A section in the project to insert the task into. The task will be inserted at the bottom of the section.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
